meanings.def: a hard black mineral that is found below the ground and burnt to produce heat
examples: I put more coal on the fire.
She sat by the coal fire in the kitchen.
Plans were being drawn up for the privatization of the coal industry.
These men had spent their lives breathing coal dust.
There are substantial reserves of methane gas trapped in coal seams in the area.
Put some more coal on the fire.

meanings.def: a piece of coal, especially one that is burning
examples: A hot coal fell out of the fire and burnt the carpet.
Red-hot coals glowed in the fireplace.

meanings.def: to take goods to a place where there are already plenty of them; to supply something where it is not needed
to criticize somebody severely because they have done something wrong
examples: I was hauled over the coals by my boss for being late.

idioms.idiom: carry, take, etc. coals to Newcastle
